meanings.definition: Routinisms: The quality or state of being routine.
meanings.sent1: Her daily routinisms included making breakfast and walking the dog.
meanings.sent2: The office routinisms made the work predictable but sometimes boring.
meanings.sent3: His routinisms were so ingrained that he accidentally made coffee instead of tea one morning.
meanings.sent4: The routinisms of the factory hummed like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The routinisms of the school day were etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: Routinisms: A habitual or mechanical performance of an established procedure.
meanings.sent1: The routinisms of his morning routine helped him start the day smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Her routinisms in the kitchen made cooking seem effortless.
meanings.sent3: The robot's routinisms were so precise that it never made a mistake.
meanings.sent4: The routinisms of the assembly line never faltered, producing cars efficiently.
meanings.sent5: His routinisms in the gym showed in his disciplined workout routine.
